text: so if you think about this box here as the cpu or the core
you've got a processor core in there, for example the intel chips that you ran on have four cores in myth
they had a i'm forgetting now what they had on aws i think we gave you eight core machines with 16 virtual, two hyperthreads per core
and then there's some caches, and on this diagram, i'm only drawing one of them i'm drawing what's called the last level cache so if you have like an l1 l2 and l3, your l3 is your last level cache
or if you just have an l1 well your l1's the last level cache we often like to think about the last level cache because that's the point in which memory requests that don't hit the cache
now have to go out to memory
and then there's a box on any modern processor that's called the memory controller, and the memory controller is responsible for
when the last level cache takes a cache miss
the processor has to go get the data from memory
and the memory controller is responsible for making that request
out to memory and then grabbing the results when they come back
and making sure the data gets into the appropriate cache and things like that
so that's what we're talking about
so where we're gonna go is we're gonna talk about the implementation of memory now as memory as dram
